content: touch of lace by barbara hurd a sweet practically symmetric triangular shawl knit diagonally in garter stitch with simple 2-row lace insert nub edge is not blocked for a bohemian touch yarn i used a local yarn farmhouse sock 100% merino color serendipity amount 410 yards/skein but i had about 20 yards remaining needles single-pointed us size 6/4mm i used 14 inch long gauge 20 sts/4 inches or 5 sts/inch stitches used row a right side k1 kfb * knit until 3 stitches from end k2tog k1 row b * knit until 2 sts from end kfb k1 lace row 1 right side k1 kfb * y/o k2tog until 2 sts from end k2tog row 2 k2 *y/o p2tog until 2 sts from end kfb k1 begin cast on 26 sts repeat row a and b until you have 66 sts on needle insert lace row 1 row 2 row a row b row 1 row 2 continue in row a and b until you have 100 sts on needle time to insert lace row 1 row 2 row a row b row 1 row 2 continue in row a and b until you have 138 sts on needle insert the above 6 row 1 2 a b 1 2 bind off in this manner on next row k1 *cast on c/o 3 sts using knitting cast on see you tube bind off b/o 6 sts repeat from * until 5 sts remain c/o 3 sts b/o 5 sts cut yarn leaving 3 inch tail and sew in evening up edge blocking i wet the entire shawl rolled it in a towel to absorb excess water then blocked it on the back of my futon do not block the picot points i prefer the bohemian look when they are left alone this is a fun shawl to work on when you can t concentrate it s perfect for a knit group coffeeshop or beachside knitting enjoy the process and the product copyright barbara hurd 2020
